generif.text: TIP30 interacts with an estrogen receptor alpha-interacting coactivator CIA and regulates ERalpha-mediated c-myc transcription.

Overexpression of TIP30 might be a promising candidate as a treatment for HCC that would increase sensitivity to chemotherapeutic drugs.

Data supported the theory that the expression of TIP30/CC3 had a suppressive function on tumor metastasis, and the decrease in expression of TIP30/CC3 is related to metastasis and may represent a new prognosticator in breast carcinoma.

Translocation of Bax was essential for TIP30-induced apoptosis, whereas overexpression of the anti-apoptotic protein Bcl-xL delayed both second mitochondria-derived activator of caspases (Smac/DIABLO) release and onset of apoptosis.
results suggest that TIP30 is involved in cellular oxidative stress surveillance and induces apoptosis through stabilization of p53 mRNA in hepatocellular carcinoma cells
TIP30 plays a role in prostate cancer progression and that TIP30 overexpression may promote prostate cancer cell growth and metastasis.
Novel pathway by which OPN and possibly other Ets-1 target genes involved in tumor metastasis are regulated by TIP30. Mechanism for metastasis promoted by TIP30 deficiency.
a novel function of TIP30, which can possibly be used as an independent prognostic factor and a potential therapeutic target for gastric cancer.
epigenetic silencing of Tip30 gene expression by CpG island DNA hypermethylation is associated with poor prognosis in patients with HCC
Data suggest that oligodendrocyte precursor cells are pathogenic in multiple sclerosis and their nucleocytoplasmic transport is impaired due to abnormally upregulated TIP30.
Decreased TIP30 expression promotes tumor metastasis in lung cancer.
These results demonstrate that promoter methylation is involved in the decreased expression of TIP30 tumor suppressor gene in human colorectal carcinoma.
we examine the pathophysiological nature of remyelination failure in chronic multiple sclerosis and discuss the role of TIP30 as a novel therapeutic target--review
Excess of cellular CC3 has a significant negative effect on DNA repair after UV and oxidant exposure, while silencing of endogenous CC3 slightly delays repair of UV-induced damage.

Data suggest that metabolic flexibility acquired by cells after silencing of CC3 could be directly relevant to the development of metastatic and aggressive human tumors that frequently have low or absent expression of CC3.
TIP30 complex regulates EGFR endocytosis by facilitating the transport of V-ATPases from trans-Golgi network to early endosomes.
overexpression of MCM2 or loss of expression of Tat-interacting protein 30 is closely related to carcinogenesis, progression, biological behavior, and prognosis of gallbladder adenocarcinoma.
The TIP30 complex facilitates biological membrane fusion through modification of phosphatidic acid on membranes.
The loss of CC3/TIP30 is related to occurrence and development in breast cancer, suggesting early onset of metastasis and recurrence.

TIP30 acts as a crucial regulator in suppressing cytoplasmic and nuclear EGFR signaling in the lung.TIP30 functions as a tumor suppressor to inhibit EGFR cytoplasmic and nuclear signaling and suppress adenocarcinogenesis in the lung.
TIP30 binds to the DNA-binding domain and the C-terminal domain of p53

We demonstrated the potential role of HTATIP2/TIP30 in ovarian cancer for the first time, thereby enlightening future studies targeting HTATIP2/TIP30 in ovarian cancer treatment, diagnosis, and prevention.
Decreased TIP30 expression is associated with pancreatic cancer.
miR-10b promotes pancreatic cancer cell proliferation and invasion by suppressing TIP30.
The results suggest a novel and critical role of TIP30 involved in hepatocellular carcinoma progression and aggressiveness.
The combination of HTATIP2 and MVD predicts the converse survival of HCC with or without sorafenib intervention.
TIP30-induced downregulation of cyclin D1 transcription antagonizes EGFR signaling and suppresses tumorigenesis
Data iindicate TIP30 was a marker in predicting the prognosis of esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC).
the present study showed that loss of HTATIP2 expression was a frequent event in glioma and is associated with poor prognosis.
Meta-analysis suggests that the rs2230199 C/G, rs1047286 C/T, rs11569536 G/A and rs2250656 A/G SNPs in the CC3 gene may be associated with age-related macular degeneration risk.
Increased HMGB1 and cleaved caspase-3 stimulate the proliferation of tumor cells and are correlated with the poor prognosis in colorectal cancer
The results of the present study indicated that TIP30 may suppress oncogenesis and glioma progression, thereby improving the prognosis of patients with glioma.

combination of sorafenib and metformin inhibits proliferation and invasion in vitro, prolongs median survival, and reduces lung metastasis of HCC in vivo. This effect is closely associated with the upregulation of TIP30
the results suggest that downregulation of TIP30 may result from HBV infection, and subsequently promotes the progression of HCC.

these data suggest that positive MCM2 and negative TIP30 expression are closely correlated with the clinical, pathological and biological parameters, in addition to poor prognosis in patients with gallbladder cancer.
TIP30 expression is associated with a good prognosis in patients with tumors.
Cholangiocarcinoma patients who had high methylation of HTATIP2 and low methylation of UCHL1 showed longer overall survival than those with low HTATIP2 methylation and high UCHL1 methylation.
Binding of HIV1 Tat to TIP30 enhanced epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition and metastasis by regulating the nuclear translocation of Snail.
These results suggest that TIP30, as a tumor suppressor in the bladder cancer, might be served as a target in cancer therapies in the future.

Here, we identified the tumor suppressor protein TIP30 as novel inhibitor of cardiac hypertrophy and dysfunction. The results are relevant for human disease, since the authors found diminished cardiac TIP30 levels in samples from patients suffering from end-stage heart failure or hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.

Genome-wide association study of the age of onset of type 1 diabetes reveals HTATIP2 as a novel T cell regulator.
HTATIP2 regulates arteriogenic activity in monocytes from patients with limb ischemia.

BP.term: regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
positive regulation of programmed cell death
positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

name: HIV-1 Tat interactive protein 2
summary: Enables protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Involved in import into nucleus and regulation of angiogenesis. Acts upstream of or within positive regulation of programmed cell death; positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II; and protein autophosphorylation. Located in cytosol and nuclear envelope. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
